page.title: 07Manor Farm, Ringland.
page.content: The original farmhouse was knocked down 17 yrs ago and there is now a new farmhouse. The farm is owned by a pensioner but managed by{Mr. {Thorogood. The Berney family}once owned Manor Farm, then{Sir Richard {Prince-Smith. Pit Farm and Low Farm have been added to the estate so there is now{870 acres, 750}of which are farmed. There are 42 fields of about 25 acres and about half of the old field boundaries still exist. Crops grown include parsnips, carrots, potatoes, winter and spring barley and sugar beet. A few sheep are kept by Mrs. Thorogood as a hobby and there is a pig unit catering for 500 piglets. Manor farm has 8 workers, 7 living in tied cottages (2 of these at Breck Barn farm) and the rest in the village.
